title: Design of IMD-Based Teaching Methods for Large-Scale Biology Concept Learning

context.prior_knowledge: High school-level foundational knowledge in life sciences
context.additional_context: Systematic biology learning in a blended environment using digital devices, with project-based assessment evaluating application capabilities

learning_goals: Analyze biology concept explanations based on the IMD (Information-Mapping Design) principles and describe at least three strategies to minimize cognitive load.
Explain core biology concepts such as cell division and genetic phenomena with ≥80% accuracy by linking visual/textual materials.
Evaluate creative problem-solving skills through team-based projects (e.g., DNA structure modeling) and achieve ≥70/100 points.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
